title: Elon Musk's mother follows this flexitarian diet to remain fit at 76
content: Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk has a modeling career of over 50 years and now at the age of 76, she can give many a run for their money, all thanks to her flexitarian diet which is no vegetarianism and more flexible than that. Maye recently posed for the 2024 Sports Illustrated Swimsuit issue on the magazine's 60th anniversary and divulged her diet secrets. Her meal are mainly home-cooked and plant-based but sometimes she indulges in meat, fish etc. and her sugar intake is less -- but not nil. Everything in moderation is her key to diet.
summary: Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk has a modeling career of over 50 years and now at the age of 76, she can give many a run for their money, all thanks to her flexitarian diet which is no vegetarianism and more flexible than that. Maye recently posed for the 2024 Sports Illustrated Swimsuit issue on the magazine's 60th anniversary and divulged her diet secrets. Her meal are mainly home-cooked and plant-based but sometimes she indulges in meat, fish etc. and her sugar intake is less -- but not nil. Everything in moderation is her key to diet.

title: Jill Biden is angry, lashing out at Democrats who want President out of race
content: First Lady Jill Biden has made it clear that her husband President Joe Biden will not withdraw from the presidential race, albeit the pressure. Now reports claimed that Jill Biden is lashing out at those who want Biden out of the race. ABC News correspondent Marth Raddatz made this claim after Biden's interview with the channel Friday.
summary: First Lady Jill Biden has made it clear that her husband President Joe Biden will not withdraw from the presidential race, albeit the pressure. Now reports claimed that Jill Biden is lashing out at those who want Biden out of the race. ABC News correspondent Marth Raddatz made this claim after Biden's interview with the channel Friday.

UN side event spotlights China's rising Islamophobia targeting Uyghurs, Kazakhs
content: Human rights activists, diplomats, and other intellectuals highlighted the growing Islamophobia in China targeting Uyghur Muslims and Kazakhs during a side event at the UN Human Rights Council's 56th session in Geneva.
summary: Human rights activists, diplomats, and other intellectuals highlighted the growing Islamophobia in China targeting Uyghur Muslims and Kazakhs during a side event at the UN Human Rights Council's 56th session in Geneva.

title: Who is Victoria Starmer? Low-profile wife of UK PM
content: While much attention has been focused on Keir's historic victory, less is known about his wife, Victoria, who maintained a relatively low profile during the election campaign. The couple, both lawyers by training, married in 2007, a year before Starmer became Director of Public Prosecutions.
summary: While much attention has been focused on Keir's historic victory, less is known about his wife, Victoria, who maintained a relatively low profile during the election campaign. The couple, both lawyers by training, married in 2007, a year before Starmer became Director of Public Prosecutions.

title: Rift in Harry and Megan's relationship? Royal family author spills the beans about couple
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are reportedly facing a rift as Meghan expresses concerns about their future. Their Netflix contract is up for renewal, and her brand, American Riviera Orchard, has faced criticism. Markle feels under pressure and believes her work is unfairly criticized, causing tension in their new life in America.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are reportedly facing a rift as Meghan expresses concerns about their future. Their Netflix contract is up for renewal, and her brand, American Riviera Orchard, has faced criticism. Markle feels under pressure and believes her work is unfairly criticized, causing tension in their new life in America.

title: Residents relocated after dam breach at China's second-largest freshwater lake

UK PM's Day 1 at 10 Downing Street: Keir Starmer appoints new cabinet ministers, speaking to world leaders
content: The UK's Labour Party, led by Keir Starmer, secured a commanding win in the July 4 general election and swiftly assembled a diverse cabinet, appointing a record 11 women to key positions. Promising national renewal, he vowed to rebuild Britain and invited opposition leaders to join his government of service. Starmer also engaged with world leaders, reinforcing alliances and pledging support for Ukraine amidst ongoing conflicts. Several world leaders congratulated Starmer for becoming the new prime minister.
summary: The UK's Labour Party, led by Keir Starmer, secured a commanding win in the July 4 general election and swiftly assembled a diverse cabinet, appointing a record 11 women to key positions. Promising national renewal, he vowed to rebuild Britain and invited opposition leaders to join his government of service. Starmer also engaged with world leaders, reinforcing alliances and pledging support for Ukraine amidst ongoing conflicts. Several world leaders congratulated Starmer for becoming the new prime minister.

title: Delaware judge rules in favour of late pop star Prince's former business advisers in estate dispute
content: Prince passed away in 2016 from an accidental fentanyl overdose, leaving no will. His six siblings inherited equal shares in the estate. Three of them assigned their combined 50 per cent interest to Prince Legacy LLC and granted McMillan and Spicer each a 10 per cent interest in the company, along with extensive and exclusive management authority.
summary: Prince passed away in 2016 from an accidental fentanyl overdose, leaving no will. His six siblings inherited equal shares in the estate. Three of them assigned their combined 50 per cent interest to Prince Legacy LLC and granted McMillan and Spicer each a 10 per cent interest in the company, along with extensive and exclusive management authority.

title: Who is Masoud Pezeshkian? Meet reformist who pledged easing headscarf law, set to be Iran's next President
4th of July mishap: Fireworks misfire, veer into crowd injuring many in Utah
content: During Utah's Fourth of July celebration at BYU's LaVell Edwards Stadium, a fireworks malfunction injured up to six spectators, prompting a brief show pause for medical attention. A rocket misfired into the stands during the Stadium of Fire event, causing one serious injury. Event organizers paused the show to aid those hurt and investigated the incident, later resuming after safety checks. Witnesses described the chaotic scene as officials assessed the mishap, ensuring subsequent fireworks were safe.
summary: During Utah's Fourth of July celebration at BYU's LaVell Edwards Stadium, a fireworks malfunction injured up to six spectators, prompting a brief show pause for medical attention. A rocket misfired into the stands during the Stadium of Fire event, causing one serious injury. Event organizers paused the show to aid those hurt and investigated the incident, later resuming after safety checks. Witnesses described the chaotic scene as officials assessed the mishap, ensuring subsequent fireworks were safe.

title: Fourth Democratic lawmaker calls on Biden to exit presidential race
Reformist candidate Masoud Pezeshkian wins Iran's presidential runoff
content: In Iran's presidential runoff election held on Saturday, Masoud Pezeshkian, a reformist candidate and heart surgeon, emerged as the winner. His campaign promises included engaging with Western nations and easing the enforcement of Iran's mandatory headscarf law. These pledges resonated with voters following a challenging period marked by sanctions and protests that have put pressure on the Islamic Republic. Pezeshkian's rival, the hard-liner Saeed Jalili, was unsuccessful in his bid for the presidency.
summary: In Iran's presidential runoff election held on Saturday, Masoud Pezeshkian, a reformist candidate and heart surgeon, emerged as the winner. His campaign promises included engaging with Western nations and easing the enforcement of Iran's mandatory headscarf law. These pledges resonated with voters following a challenging period marked by sanctions and protests that have put pressure on the Islamic Republic. Pezeshkian's rival, the hard-liner Saeed Jalili, was unsuccessful in his bid for the presidency.

title: 'I was sick': Joe Biden looks for excuses in first interview after terrible debate performance
content: "I was sick, I was feeling terrible... We were trying to figure out what's wrong," Biden explained in an excerpt from his first television interview since the debate. "They did a test to see whether or not I had some infection, you know, a virus. I didn't. I just had a really bad cold." As supporters cheered, Biden also attacked his rival, reading from teleprompters. "Let's focus on what really matters," he said.
summary: "I was sick, I was feeling terrible... We were trying to figure out what's wrong," Biden explained in an excerpt from his first television interview since the debate. "They did a test to see whether or not I had some infection, you know, a virus. I didn't. I just had a really bad cold." As supporters cheered, Biden also attacked his rival, reading from teleprompters. "Let's focus on what really matters," he said.
